course.subject: ENGG
course.name: Robotics Special Project: ABU Robocon 2019
course.description: The Asia-Pacific Robot Contest (ABU Robocon) is an Asian Oceanian College robot competition for young engineers. Student teams will design and manufacture the robots for tackling with different missions and challenges which is provided the organizer. Normally, a project report is required. Enrollment in the project course may require instructor's approval. May be graded PP.

reviews.author: Alphalch
reviews.comment_content:
To enroll in the course you must go through the selection process of HKUST Robotics team. You have to join the robotics team through the internal competition in November.

Each year there is a different theme of the competition prepared by the host country, and if we win the regional competition in June, we will be able to fly to another country to join the international competition. Also, you will gain a lot of opportunities to fly to different countries and visit top universities from different countries in Asia.
reviews.comment_teaching: Materials are mainly prepared by seniors. Which are pretty good and useful. However, you have to learn everything by yourself if you want to win the competition, especially when you don't have the background knowledge to begin with.
reviews.comment_grading: Guaranteed A range if you always go to the lab and got recognized by TAs and Tim Woo.
reviews.comment_workload: The workload is subjective, but it has a linear relation to your grade. Set grades aside, if you really like robotics, you will enjoy it, although it does require effort, at the end of the day, you will learn a lot from robotics design to software coding, it's really fun.

reviews.author: dzung
reviews.title: for robocon contestants
reviews.comment_content: to enroll in the course you need to join the robotics team through the internal competition in november, and afterwards you work in the team until the competition in june/august. each year theres a different theme of the competition, and if we win the hong kong competition in june we get to go to another country for the international (if not another university gets to go)
reviews.comment_teaching: mainly teaching by senior members, essentially you need to learn everything by yourself as you most likely dont have a lot of specific technical knowledge when you first join
reviews.comment_grading: A+ unless you dont go to lab and work a.k.a. get looked down on by your teammates
reviews.comment_workload: of course once you join the team you are expected to work very hard, go to lab everyday,... it does require a ton of effort but in the end its really fun
